Experience in multiple phases which includes writing requirements, proposing architecture and design, solution implementation, verification, validation and delivery for firmware and software platforms, from initial conception to successful execution.
Ability to promote customer happiness with capability to establish effective working relationships with internal partners, and the external customers
Ability to perform multiple tasks with limited oversight
Capable of playing the nodal technical role for large scale programs.

HTSIND2022

You Must Have

B.E / B. Tech / M. Tech in Electrical or Electronics engineering or Control System Engineering.
6-8 years experience in Systems Engineering
Knowledge on Environmental Control Systems product line
Working experience on system architectures
Knowledge on Aerospace System Standards - ARP4754, ARP4761
Knowledge of System Equipment Specification (SES), Inter Internal communication Document (IICD) and Software Requirement Specification (SRS)
Demonstrated capability to perform system integration testing or functional qualification testing in system integration test bench environment
Understanding on communication protocols like AFDX, CAN, A429
Proficient experience on Control Systems with sound knowledge of MATLAB/Simulink modeling
Proficient experience on change management (ex: DOORS, Serena/ClearCase tools)
Knowledge on Agile (Sprint, Kanban) and waterfall models and practices
Interpersonal skills to work with multi-functional teams and able to support aircraft level verification activity
Contribute to product strategies, technology roadmaps and improvements in engineering quality and efficiency

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD188167
Category: Engineering
Location: HW Camp II,Bldgs 9A&9B,Plot C2,RMZ Ecoworld,Varturhobli,Sarjapur Marathahalli Outer Ring Road,Bangalore,KARNATAKA,560103,India
Exempt
Engineering (GLOBAL)

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - SRE Cloud Ops
job_desc:
About the job
If you are looking for a career with solid job prospects for the foreseeable future, understanding, delivering, or improving the range of activities to support the digital and energy transition, then this role will suit you. Join Shell and let us help you grow in a business that encourages both personal and professional development.




Where you fit in




Senior Software Engineer – SRE Cloud Operations understands, delivers, or improves the range of activities necessary to seamlessly integrate and operate one of the world’s largest IT estates. The scope covers service management activities, Hybrid on-premises and Cloud operational landscapes with many integration points; and the integration of the interdependent services of diverse internal and external service providers into end-to-end services which deliver value to Shell.




What’s The Role




As Senior Software Engineer – SRE Cloud Ops have end to end accountable for the operations of the landscapes and the delivery of the day-to-day application services according to the agreed Service Levels and/or Operate Level Agreements within their scope. You are the service integrator (end-to-end) to ensure applications landscapes remain compliant. You drive Incident/Problem resolution by assisting in key operational activities in terms of delivery, fixes, and supportability with operations staff and/suppliers.




Aside from above, you are expected for the following:




Deployment & configuration of business solutions and Applications preferably into Azure (Primary) & AWS (Secondary).
Preparation of deployment scripts
Provide support for deployed solutions in a production IaaS environment
Engage in production support activities
Provide technical advisory and support to product delivery teams in containerization like Kubernetes, programming language Perl, Python etc
Govern implementation to ensure quality standards are met
Facilitate communication between technical and non-technical parties
Drive Incident/Problem resolution by assisting in key operational activities in terms of delivery, fixes, and supportability with operations staff and/suppliers.
Escalation point for operation-related issues. Manage and coordinate S@R and Situations.
Ensure that end-to-end performance is monitored and maintained to high level of quality, standards, supportability, and operability as defined within negotiated and agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and to propose and implement necessary Service Improvements.
Responsible to ensure the Application portfolio is compliant with the relevant IT controls and information security standards & baselines.
Be responsible for the execution/deployment of releases and approval of service changes.
Support and advisory to application teams to effectively represent the Operate organization to the Business Stakeholders.
Promote Continuous Improvement culture within own scope of accountability (within Shell team and 3rd party suppliers)
Expertise in the skills required for MS Azure and AWS IaaS provisioning & hosting
Ensure regulatory and compliance controls are embedded in landscape operations and assist with evidence collection
Assist with supportability and transition activities of enhancements and project solutions.
Analyzing and understanding business functional and non-functional requirements for supportability impact, as well as assessing implications of landscape changes and reviewing for enhancement and continuous improvement opportunities.
Build knowledge of relevant information risks and regulatory requirements.




What We Need From You




Educated to degree level, preferably in Information Technology
9+ years of experience in an IT application support environment supporting critical business applications.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Deep knowledge of service support, operation & design processes (ITIL)
Deep knowledge of infrastructure landscapes including underlying infrastructure concepts
Operating Systems Management (Windows, Linux) – knowledge of Cloud management tooling, such as: ServiceNow, PowerBI, PowerShell, Bash, SCCM, SCOM
Enterprise Monitoring Tools for infrastructure and applications (knowledge of Azure App Insights, OMS, Security Center)
Continuous Integration/DevOps tools & techniques – experience with: source mg (GIT, CodeCommit, VSTS)
Hands on development experience with SOAP, REStful API’s, WCF/ WPF, Azure API Management/ Gateway, Logic APPs/ API Apps (Primary); Apex, Visualforce and/or the salesforce.com API (Secondary)
Experience in Unit testing solution components
Storage architecture and technologies (knowledge of)
TCP/IP Networking – knowledge of routing, firewalls, load balancers, DNS, messaging & security
Databases – knowledge of relational databases & integration (Oracle, SQL, other)
Security Architecture – knowledge of Access Management & Security Protocols (AWS-IAM, Azure AD), SSL Certificate/Key Management, OAuth, SAML or OpenID Connect.
Cloud Migration or Data Center Migration experience.
Enterprise IT Service Management and CMDB Tools (knowledge of)
Beneficial to have experience with IT project participation
Ability to operate in a global, virtual cross cultural organization, working in different time zones.
Ability to influence others and work through others to deliver the desired results.
Be able to work under pressure. Deliver solutions fast, but to quality standards and in a compliant way
Risk, Security, and Audit compliance experience.
skills: ['Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)', 'Microsoft Azure', 'OAuth', 'OpenID', 'OpenID Connect', 'OpenID Connect (OIDC)', 'Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML)', 'Transport Layer Security (TLS)', 'Visualforce', 'Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF)']

job_desc:
About the job
Chief Architect




Qualification




Science / Engineering graduate




Responsibility




Innovation and Thought Leadership:




Incubate new product assets/ tools/ concepts to improve non linear revenue
Create, publish/ review white papers / technical papers.
Present the papers in national/ international publications & conferences.
Foster a innovative culture within the team( eg, Encourage teams to identify solutions from other industries / verticals / partners and apply to problem context).
Identify newer opportunities for contribution / newer ways of leveraging technology for solving customer problems.
Understand the clients requirements, pain points and arrive at a customized solution by rightly positioning Cognizant assets.
Collaborate with technology groups and other alliances to bring best practices on various technologies and tools.




Technology Consulting




Understand the customer problem / engagement objectives.
Develop custom solution by leveraging assets / services from the global market place Provide recommendations to the client on tools, technologies for deployment on the basis of features, cost, performance etc.
Build relationships and credibility with customers.
Identify the appropriate quality model/ standard/ measure to be adopted in the project in conjunction with the customer requirements.
Influence the customer to adopt the appropriate point of view on the solution aspects ( eg, quality standard, solution option, technology option etc).




COE / Practice Roadmap - Business Planning And Development




Understand trends in technology landscape, customer buying patterns, market place shifts(eg, M&A, product expiry etc) & identify newer opportunities for contribution.
Understand pain points from a customer/vertical perspective for developing specific solutions.
Develop business case for the new service offering.
Identify the customer segment to position the new offering.
Develop the high level build and launch plan/priority for the offerings in alignment with Cognizant focus areas.
Develop the skills plan & budget requirements to support the new / current offerings.
Develop business case for the initiatives.




New Solution Development




Identify objectives and define the planning process.
Develop solution blueprint – involving partner capabilities, inhouse capabilities and new build.
Create inhouse capabilities to support delivery in these new offerings.
Develop business case , joint GTM plan with the partner and collaterals.
Create artifacts from perspective of technology, product, domain and infrastructure as applicable.




Alliance Management




Collaborate with alliances to bring best practices on various technologies and tools.




Knowledge Management & Capability Development




Identify technical skill gaps / capability gaps in comparison with the applicable business plan for the team.
Arrive at roadmap to close the skills/ capability gap in collaboration with internal and external partners as appropriate.
Support talent acquisition activities.
Develop / Review collaterals from current/past engagements.




Project Control And Review




Provide technical SME support in reviewing large transformational / complex technical solutions / data models in terms of compliance to requirements, efficiency of solution or implementation.
Act as the final escalation support for the respective technology areas.




IP Building And Management




Identify patentable components in the solution and follow up on IP filing with the necessary teams.




People Management




Understand aspirations of associates, identify programs and certifications, growth areas for associates based on aspirations, project requirements.
Mentor and coach associates.
Monitor and manage the team member performance.




Asset Development And Governance




As part of innovation / solution development, arrive at the asset development plan and business case.
Provide the technical leadership, support and governance to build the assets.
Propagate the appropriate consumers – both internal and external.
Monitor the effectiveness of assets developed.




Sales Support And Project Estimation




Develop (for large deals) / Review technical solution proposed.
Develop (for large deals) / Review estimates for proposed solution.
Validate/Propose leverage of accelerators.




Must Have Skills




AWS
Microservices
Portfolio & Project mgmt (PPM)
Enterprise Architect




Employee Status : Full Time Employee




Shift : Day Job




Travel : No




Job Posting : Jan 19 2023




About Cognizant




Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant. 000451706814

job_desc:
About the job
Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

The team you'll be part of

As Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.

What You Will Learn And Contribute To

Are you passionate about solving problems?

As part of our team, you will:

Responsible for Design, implementation, reviews and documentation in assigned technical area.
Have opportunities to be part of the core R&D and work in the areas of applications in the domain of Video Analytics, Anomaly Detection, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Cloud/SaaS deployment along with significant artificial intelligence implementation.
Program Execution: You will work as developer along with a team in creating well tested high-quality software. You will apply modern agile development & DevOps practices in achieving this.


Your Skills And Experience
Expert level experience in C++, Python, Javascript and TypeScript.
Expert level programming knowledge in ML/DL (PyTorch, Tensorflow,scikit-learn etc) and OpenCV is required.
Functional level programming knowledge in ReactJS/ AngularJS, websockets, and NPM modules, HTML and CSS.
Knowledge of SQL (Oracle/ Maria DB) / NO SQL data bases (Cassandra, Redis etc)
Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders to deliver high quality products and services that meet business requirements and exceeds. expectations while applying the latest available tools and technology.
Effectively communicate status, issues, and risks in a precise and timely manner
Knowledge in Messaging and streaming frameworks like
RabbitMQ / Kafka messaging APIs and push notifications are a plus.
Familiarity with Continuous Integration and DevOps methodologies and tools chain
e.g. Jenkins, Cucumber, automated unit/functional testing tools.
Interested in Innovation and ideation. Contribute to development of new products by building quick POCs and converting ideas into real products.
Ensuring responsiveness of applications.
Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.
Excellent verbal communication skills. Good problem-solving skills. Qualifications
Experience Level : 3-7 Year experience
Engineering Degree in CSE/IT/ECE or equivalent


What We Offer

Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation


At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.

Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Job

Software - Applied R&D Engineer

Primary Location

India-India-Karnataka-Bangalore

Schedule

Full-time
skills: ['Problem Solving', 'Python (Programming Language)', 'AngularJS', 'C++', 'Oral Communication', 'Programming', 'Research and Development (R&D)', 'Responsiveness', 'TypeScript', 'WebSocket']

Functional level programming knowledge in ReactJS/ AngularJS, websockets, and NPM modules, HTML and CSS.
Knowledge of SQL (Oracle/ Maria DB) / NO SQL data bases (Cassandra, Redis etc)
Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders to deliver high quality products and services that meet business requirements and exceeds. expectations while applying the latest available tools and technology.
Effectively communicate status, issues, and risks in a precise and timely manner
Knowledge in Messaging and streaming frameworks like
RabbitMQ / Kafka messaging APIs and push notifications are a plus.
Familiarity with Continuous Integration and DevOps methodologies and tools chain
e.g. Jenkins, Cucumber, automated unit/functional testing tools.
Interested in Innovation and ideation. Contribute to development of new products by building quick POCs and converting ideas into real products.
Ensuring responsiveness of applications.
Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.
Excellent verbal communication skills. Good problem-solving skills. Qualifications
Experience Level : 3-7 Year experience
Engineering Degree in CSE/IT/ECE or equivalent


What We Offer

Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation


At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.

Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

About the job
Job Description

Role Proficiency:

Independently develops error free code with high quality validation of applications guides other developers and assists Lead 1 – Software Engineering

Identify the problem patterns and improve the technical design of the application/system

UST is looking for Azure data engineer with a minimum of 5 + years of experience Data Analytics/Engineering. Responsible for delivering senior level innovative, compelling, coherent software solutions for our customer operations and value chain constituents across a wide variety of enterprise applications through the creation of discrete business services and their supporting components. The job duties and requirements are defined for backend. Provides technical leadership and mentorship to junior team members. Responsibilities:

Designs, develops and delivers solutions that meet business line and enterprise requirements.
Creates data and reporting infrastructure by building and optimizing production-grade data pipelines using continuous integration/ continuous deployment. �� Participates in rapid prototyping and POC development efforts.
Understand business and technical requirements and constraints to design effective data engineering solutions.

5+ years of experiences of designing and implementing data lake, data warehouse and data mart.

Experience with ADF, ADLS, Airflow, DBT and any of cloud-native data warehouse (Snowflake, DataBricks, BigQuery).
Excels in a rapid iteration environment with short turnaround times.
Strong SQL experience, with expert-level skills in query performance tuning and data modeling.
Experience designing enterprise database systems using Microsoft SQL Server.
Has working knowledge of GIT. Develops branching and merging strategies.
Ability to design, develop, and maintain scalable, reusable code.

Knowledge of cubes and SSAS is a plus.
Knowledge of SSRS, PowerBI, Tableau is a plus.

job_desc:
About the job
Ciena is committed to our people-first philosophy. Our teams enjoy a culture focused on prioritizing a personalized and flexible work environment that empowers an individual’s passions, growth, wellbeing and belonging. We’re a technology company that leads with our humanity—driving our business priorities alongside meaningful social, community, and societal impact.

Why Ciena

We are big proponents of life-work integration and provide the flexibility and tools to make it a reality with remote work and potentially, part-time work.
We believe an inclusive, diverse and barrier-free work environment makes for empowered and committed employees.
We recognize the importance of well-being and offer programs and benefits to support and sustain the mental and physical health of our employees and their families and also offer a variety of paid family leave programs.
We are committed to employee development, offering tuition reimbursement and a variety of in-house learning and mentorship opportunities.
We know that financial security is important.  We offer competitive salaries and incentive programs, RSU’s (job level specific) and an employee share option purchase program.
We realize time away to recharge is non-negotiable.  We offer flexible paid time off!
Phenomenal work deserves recognition. We have a robust recognition program, with ongoing and enhanced awards for outstanding performance.

How You Will Contribute:  

Blue Planet www.blueplanet.com, the software division of Ciena, provides best-in-class intelligent automation software and niche professional services to help clients modernize their IT and network operations. Driven by policy and AI-based insights, Blue Planet delivers the closed-loop automation tools needed to align IT and networking processes—critical to facilitating digital transformation and an adaptive network. 

Responsibilities

Build and nurture highly available systems on Kubernetes
Implement design patterns for distributed systems
Improve delivery systems with Continuous Integration
Troubleshoot issues and tackle problems where needed

What Does Ciena Expect of You?

Initiative – You’re a self-starter who works with limited direction and is committed to delivering against aggressive deadlines.
Agility – you are readily able to make key decisions and manage competing and ever-changing priorities.
Communication expertise – you possess the ability to influence and tailor your message and ideas to the audience to ensure understanding and agreement.
The flexibility to work independently and as part of a broader team – you thrive in a multi-disciplinary team environment, but are comfortable working independently as required.
Relationship builder – with an ability to influence, you’re able to quickly develop trusted connections and get work done across multi sites.
A dedication to innovation – you keep abreast of the market and competitive developments and are always keen to formulate new insights and problem solve.
A passion for mentor – fully understanding and appreciating the power of the mentorship role.
Must Have
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent degree
8+ years of experience in Software development & design
At least 3+ years of proven experience working with Kubernetes and Docker
Solid understanding in Java, Python
Understanding of microservice design and architectural patterns
Experience with container technologies like Docker
Detailed knowledge of cloud-native development (AWS/Azure)
Expertise in DevOps and CI/CD implementation
Expertise in Linux
Knowledge of hybrid cloud environments
Comfortable collaborating with team-mates working from around the globe
Domain expertise in Network Management Systems is a plus

At Ciena, we are committed to building and fostering an environment in which our employees feel respected, valued, and heard. Ciena values the diversity of its workforce and respects its employees as individuals. We do not tolerate any form of discrimination.

If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, please advise Ciena of any accommodation measures you may require.

About the job
About This Role

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Software Engineer

In This Role, You Will

Requirements gathering, design, development, test, release for automation scripts/processes in Python/Ansible
Creating/modifying/automating the operational reports.
Establishing system / data integrations to enhance existing or establish new processes
Utilizing Ansible orchestration and Python scripting to simplify high volume and/or high risk tasks for business partners
Providing strategic direction and feedback on future automation tooling needs Utilizing scripting and other available solutions to simplify high volume and/or high-risk tasks within the lab
Partner cross-functionally with other Product Infrastructure teams in order to continuously improve and apply standards and policies relevant to operational excellence
Required Qualifications:

Overall 15+ years of experience in automation or software delivery
8+ years of hands-on experience in one or a combination of the following: enterprise network, SDWAN, network automation or network configuration.
4+ years of advanced scripting experience using Ansible or Python
5+ years of experience developing and using RESTful Application Program Interface (API)
10+ years of experience with Linux OS environment
8+ years of experience with source coding in one or a combination of the following: GiT/GitHub, SVN(Subversion), TFVC (Team Foundation Version Control) or TFSGit (Team Foundation Server.
Excellent technical design documentation and verbal communication skills
Must be self-driven and able to work with little supervision and direction
Desired Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computers or Electronics with 15+ Years of Networking /Network Automation Experience
Act as senior TM and work closely with various LoB, stakeholders to understand requirements, define and develop appropriate solutions for Network Automation.
Primary area of contribution would be network administration and development of work flow Automation for Compliance, configuration mgmt. and software code control in highly complex network environment.
Development of standards to govern the deployment of Network Automation solutions and services within core network based on best practices and model driven approach.
Good understanding of Networking protocols and Arista/Cisco latest product line - ISR, ASR, Nexus, Cisco ACI Fabric and Infrastructure Automation management using Ansible is highly desirable
Should be experienced in writing template - Jinja / YAML /Python along hands on experience in Orchestration platforms, Ansible configuration, Writing playbooks etc.
Familiar with Network products/technologies - TCP/IP , OSPF, BGP, VXLAN, SSL, DNS, Routing, Switching, etc.
2+ years of experience writing automated test cases
Strong understanding of the software testing methodology (test cases, test suites, DUTs, SUTs, unit testing, system testing, integration testing)
Core Skills:

Networking Domain, SDWAN, Ansible and Python programming
We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in US: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Candidates applying to job openings posted in Canada: Applications for employment are encouraged from all qualified candidates, including women, persons with disabilities, aboriginal peoples and visible minorities. job_desc:
About the job
Job # 617538




When you join Verizon




Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward – and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.




What you’ll be doing...




At VCG Verizon India Field Operations, we provide the complete production support for the assisted channels to ensure that all the mission critical applications are being monitored via alerting reports/dashboards to provide seamless customerservice and all the customer escalated issues/ AYS tickets created by reps are being addressed within stipulated SLA’s.




Running the war room meetings with Dev teams for addressing the priority AYS tickets.
Triaging for the AYS tickets created by reps and resolving the tickets within the given SLA's.
Creating CMD for the critical issues and helping the dev teams with our level 2 triaging analysis to make sure critical issues is being addressed and fixed.




Where you'll be working...




In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.




What we’re looking for...




You’ll Need To Have




Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Four or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in the Operations Incident ticket level two triaging.
Experience in handling the CMD efforts / War rooms.
Experience in the NSA Domain knowledge.
Experience in JIRA's, Reporting tools, Kibana.




Even better if you have one or more of the following:




Good Analytical Skills in solving the problems.
Unix Shell Scripting.
Relational database and NoSql Cassandra.
RPA Automation.




If Verizon and this role sounds a like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every "even better" qualification listed above.




Diversity & Inclusion




We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.




COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement




Please note, in countries where there is a COVID-19 related government order or rule, Verizon is required to ensure that all employees accessing our workplace comply with these mandatory requirements. If you work in one of these locations, you will be required to provide us with your vaccination status prior to joining. If this, or any other COVID related requirement applies in your location, we will notify you about this before you start work.

job_title: Hardware System Test Engineer- General Squad
job_desc:
About the job
629520BR




Introduction




Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of




Your Role and Responsibilities




The position is for skilled test professionals to perform Hardware System test validation. They will perform system assurance tests and create test cases on scaled scenarios on different versions of the latest family of IBM Power servers utilizing several versions of PHYP, Power Firmware, and releases.




Employees will be working closely with Development and Functional test organization in defining the test planning, scoping the valid scenarios for Line Items/Features. Employees will also work on troubleshooting and debugging customer field issues and incorporating test cases/updating existing test cases to further strengthen the test plan to maintain high product quality and customer satisfaction.




Teamwork is expected to be of the highest quality.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




3+ years of experience in Install, configure, tuning and troubleshooting Servers.
Technical Leadership to drive the component test and report progress & issues in the mullitple IBM Power Systems
Operating System Test experience with – Kernel concepts and Internals (Process Management, Memory Management, Virtualization, Scheduling, Networking, Security etc.)
Strong VIOS Administration skills (Install/Manage OS, Filesystems/LVM, AIX/Linux Commands, IO, PowerVM functionalities). IBM Power Systems exposure preferred
Write and execute test cases with the ability to ensure proper coverage based on Line items/features requirements and workloads, and perform regression testing (Experience in EWM is a plus)
Knowledge of end-to-end of Defect Management
Knowledge of Agile and DevOps practices and methodologies including Continuous Integration (CI)/Continuous Deployment (CD)/Continuous Testing (CT)
Ability to handle testing and debugging tasks independently
Strong team player with good communication (verbal/written) and interpersonal skills
C or Java Programming
Experience in Rational Quality Manager
Knowledge of Rational SDLC Tools (RTC, CQ)
Knowledge of Big Data and Analytics




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




None




About Business Unit




IBM Systems helps IT leaders think differently about their infrastructure. IBM servers and storage are no longer inanimate - they can understand, reason, and learn so our clients can innovate while avoiding IT issues. Our systems power the world’s most important industries and our clients are the architects of the future. Join us to help build our leading-edge technology portfolio designed for cognitive business and optimized for cloud computing.




This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date and proof of vaccination status will be required before your start date. During the Onboarding process you will be asked to confirm your vaccination status, in case you are unable to get vaccinated for any reason, you can let us know at that stage. Please let us know if you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons. IBM will consider such requests on a case by case basis subject to submission of required proof by the candidate before a stipulated date.




Your Life @ IBM




In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.




Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.




Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.




Are you ready to be an IBMer?




About IBM




IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.




Location Statement




When applying to jobs of your interest, we recommend that you do so for those that match your experience and expertise. Our recruiters advise that you apply to not more than 3 roles in a year for the best candidate experience.




For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.




Being You @ IBM




IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

job_desc:
About the job
Job Description Summary

The Site Reliability Engineering team is responsible for the reliability and performance of tools worldwide. We obsess over availability by building tools and engineering new systems to automate our platform. We are software engineers with full visibility and influence across the entire stack.GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our purpose is to create a world where healthcare has no limits. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.

Job Description

Roles and Responsibilities:

In this role, you will:

• Develop automated solutions to predict and address potential problems before they result in a service interruption• Oversee and adapt monitoring and alerting systems• Collaborate with all GE business units worldwide, providing a bastion technical expertise• Identify potential process improvements across the entire engineering organization• Define and drive architectural enhancements into system to mitigate potential failure points• Provide impact assessment and mitigation plan for changes going into the production environment• Investigate root cause of severe and systemic outages, identify corrective actions• Establish performance baseline, capacity thresholds, correlate events, and define monitoring/alerting criteria• Provide technical coaching and direction to more junior teammates

Educational Qualification:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) with advanced experience.

Looking for 10+ Years of hands on experience.

Desired Characteristics:

Technical Expertise:

• Excellent knowledge of UNIX system internals• Strong analytical and problem solving skills• Experience with all stages of an agile software development lifecycle (CI/CD)• Familiar with large scale cluster management systems (Mesos, Kubernetes)• Demonstrated ability to script around repeatable tasks (Go/Ruby/Python/Bash)• Experience with developing cloud-native applications (High Availability)• Able to dive into any level of a modern internet service (schedulers, containers, Linux kernel,caching, object storage, distributed filesystems, RDBMS, NoSQL, etc.)• Comfortable with network troubleshooting (tcpdump, routing, proxies, firewalls, load balancers,etc.)• Able to troubleshoot and debug applications (C/Java/Go)• Proficient in configuration management systems (Chef, Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Salt)• Experience with configuring, customizing, and extending monitoring tools (Sensu/Grafana/Prometheus/Graphite/Splunk, etc.)• Experience deploying and managing infrastructure on public clouds (AWS or GCP or Azure)• Comfortable using Git on the command line

Leadership:

• Influences through others; builds direct and "behind the scenes" support for ideas. Preemptivelysees downstream consequences and effectively tailors influencing strategy to support a• positive outcome.• Able to verbalize what is behind decisions and downstream implications. Continuouslyreflecting on success and failures to improve performance and decision-making. Understands and encourages change when needed.• Proactively identifies and removes project obstacles or barriers on behalf of the team.• Able to navigate accountability in a matrixed organization.• Self-starter; communicates and demonstrates a shared sense of purpose. Learns from failure.

Personal Attributes:

• Critical thinker; able to quickly adapt to changing environments• A hacker or tinkerer at heart• Risk taker, not afraid to think outside the box or challenge the status quo• Emotional Intelligence, ability to influence up and out and the ability to work independently• Must be a team player with a strong desire to win• Passionate about continuously learning• Highly organized and efficient; able to balance competing priorities and execute accordingly• Strong oral and written communication skills.

GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.

Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.



Additional Information

Relocation Assistance Provided: No

As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to lead the engagement effort of providing high-quality and value-adding consulting solutions to customers at different stages- from problem definition to diagnosis to solution design, development and deployment.
You will review the proposals prepared by consultants, provide guidance, and analyze the solutions defined for the client business problems to identify any potential risks and issues.

You would be a key contributor in unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high-quality, value-adding consulting solutions to customers adhering to the guidelines and processes of the organization. A day in the life of an Infoscion

As part of the Infosys consulting team, your primary role would be to lead the engagement effort of providing high-quality and value-adding consulting solutions to customers at different stages- from problem definition to diagnosis to solution design, development and deployment.
You will review the proposals prepared by consultants, provide guidance, and analyze the solutions defined for the client business problems to identify any potential risks and issues.
You will identify change Management requirements and propose a structured approach to client for managing the change using multiple communication mechanisms.
You will also coach and create a vision for the team, provide subject matter training for your focus areas, motivate and inspire team members through effective and timely feedback and recognition for high performance.
You would be a key contributor in unit-level and organizational initiatives with an objective of providing high-quality, value-adding consulting solutions to customers adhering to the guidelines and processes of the organization. If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you!
Good knowledge on software configuration management systems
Strong business acumen, strategy and cross-industry thought leadership
Awareness of latest technologies and Industry trends
Logical thinking and problem solving skills along with an ability to collaborate
Two or three industry domain knowledge
Understanding of the financial processes for various types of projects and the various pricing models available
Client Interfacing skills
Knowledge of SDLC and agile methodologies
Project and Team management
skills: ['Agile Methodologies', 'DevOps', 'Scrum']

job_desc:
About the job
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.




Directory Engineering Senior Engineer




Today’s world is fueled by vast amounts of information, which means that data is even more valuable than ever before. Protecting data and information systems is central to doing business, and therefore everyone in EY Information Security has an important role to play. Join a global team of almost 950 people who collaborate to support the business of EY by protecting EY and client information assets! Information Security professionals enable EY to work securely and deliver secure products and services, as well as detect and quickly respond when things go wrong. Together, the efforts of our dedicated team help protect the EY brand and build client trust.




Within Information Security we blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security and technology service solutions as we consider the entire security lifecycle. You will join a team of highly knowledgeable, security-focused individuals dedicated to supporting, protecting, and enabling the business through innovative, secure solutions that provide speed to market and business value.




The opportunity




Identity and Access Management (IAM) organization, a part of Information Security which, enables over 330,000 individuals across 140+ countries to access systems and information securely. As a member of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) team this position will contribute towards execution of an IAM roadmap that meets security requirements, including but not limited to security for, a complex Active Directory (AD) and Azure AD (AAD) environment, hybrid cloud deployment, mobile computing, policy driven security, SSO, identity lifecycle management, and federation focusing on multiple protocols.




We offer opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career receiving support, coaching and feedback from colleagues around the world. This role will give you an opportunity to work with some of the best talent in the industry!




Your Key Responsibilities




The role will be working within a globally distributed team responsible for the architecture, design and development of systems supporting the AD and AAD environment for EY.




The role designs and develops architectural elements or modifications including integrated processes, applications, data, and technology remediation. Responsibilities also include coordinating with various technology infrastructure teams for infrastructure projects, managing systems lifecycle, and evaluating existing solutions for optimizations or enhancements.




The Directory Enablement Senior Engineer will be responsible for developing, engineering, deploying, and supporting comprehensive solutions. This will include managing effort to find opportunities for the automation of tasks, processes, or entire solutions and acting on them, as well as identifying any opportunities for improvement in the environment.




The role maintains directory technologies, supporting infrastructure, and other security aligned functions and performs all work in alignment to EY’s compliance standards for technology development and deployment.




Mentor and guide individuals across the Globe and maintain effective and efficient oversight of all aligned activities.
Work in a diverse, global environment and build strong relationships across all levels of a matrixed, geographically, and culturally dispersed organization.
Participate in or lead troubleshooting and incident resolution of complex high severity incidents.
Apply modern best practices, standards/principles, global product-specific guidelines, security standards, and design standards to security solutions and services as appropriate.




Skills And Attributes For Success




Proven understanding of a hybrid Identity infrastructure using Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services and Microsoft Azure AD.
Consultative skill to translate business needs into workable technology solutions that meet the needs of internal customers.
Deep technical proficiency in designing, developing, and debugging solutions.
Resolves production and system enhancement issues.
Develops working relationships with peers across Development & Engineering and Architecture teams, collaborating to develop solutions.
Drives alignment to the relevant processes, procedures, standards, technical design.
Attention to detail and a security minded approach to solving problems.
Excellent interpersonal communication and organizational skills and the ability to work within tight timeframes.
Rapidly learn new and emerging technologies with ability to rapidly define engineering standards.
Passionate about delivering a highly secure and stable environment with an eye for continuous improvement.
Experience with integrating new and emerging technologies into an environment and welcomes the opportunity to work on cloud-based platforms.




To qualify for the role, you must have




Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Mathematics or a related field, or equivalent work experience required
8+ years of experience in an engineering role, demonstrating progression of increasingly complex job responsibilities during the period inclusive of project management skills, engineering remediation techniques and project planning and implementation.
Certification as a Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA)
8+ years Active Directory
2+ years Azure AD
3+ years PowerShell scripting




Ideally, you’ll also have




Understanding and experience with Azure managed services.
Understanding and experience with Cloud service providers, such as AWS.
Understanding and experience with System Center Configuration Manager.
Understanding and experience with Quest Change Auditor
Understanding and experience with Quest Active Roles Server
Understanding and experience with Azure Kusto Query Language (KQL)
Understanding and experience with Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL)
Understanding and experience with Microsoft Enhanced Security Admin Environment (ESAE)
Understanding and experience with Process Automation product such as Azure Automation or Orchestrator.
Understanding and experience with Quest Recovery Manager for Active Directory (RMAD)




Recommended certifications to progress career development may include:




ITIL Foundations




What We Look For




Seeking self-motivated, well-organized, and detail-oriented individuals who are interested to engage and progress within a strong and dynamic team environment. Ability to work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment with superb communication and collaboration skills (excellent written, verbal, and listening skillsets) would be ideal.




A self-starter, independent-thinker, curious and creative person with ambition to learn and passion for delivering security solutions and services.




What We Offer




As part of this role, you will work in a highly coordinated, globally diverse team with the opportunity and tools to grow, develop and drive your career forward. Here, you can combine global opportunity with flexible working. The EY benefits package goes above and beyond too, focusing on your physical, emotional, financial, and social well-being. Your recruiter can talk to you about the benefits available in your country. Here’s a snapshot of what we offer:




Continuous learning: You will develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We will provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a significant impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We will give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You will be accepted for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.




EY | Building a better working world




EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.




Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.




Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
skills: ['Computer Science', 'Azure Kusto', 'Debugging', 'Kusto Query Language (KQL)', 'Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager', 'Process Automation', 'Query Languages', 'Query Writing', 'System Center', 'Technical Proficiency']

job_desc:
About the job
The Position




Senior DevOps Engineer - Product IT Center of Enablement in Diagnostics IT





Who We Are




Roche’s expanding digital product portfolio demonstrates its commitment to provide healthcare professionals, laboratories, and patients with digital and digitally-enabled solutions that transform patient care. The existing product portfolio includes decision support systems, data management solutions, and workflow solutions. At the center of these diverse types of solutions is always patient data security and privacy as the highest priority for Roche.




In this context, Roche has built a global team that builds, secures, and operates infrastructure platforms (cloud and on-prem) for its digital products. This team is working with a high freedom to operate in a self-organized setup and is responsible for tackling the cybersecurity, compliance, and infrastructure challenges of the healthcare industry while enabling high-velocity product development.




The Position




In the position of Senior DevOps Engineer you will join the Diagnostic Product IT Center of Enablement team and will be part of the Cloud security team.




As a Cloud Security Engineer with good experience in monitoring and improving DevSecOps tools and processes, you will automate routine tasks and improve system reliability.




You will also play a critical role in providing technical support for day-to-day security operations, security tool integration, automation support, change management and business continuity programs.




As the Senior DevOps Engineer, you will:




Create and maintain command line and web/rest applications (design, document, develop, test and deploy)
Create scripts, customizations, templates to ensure speed of delivery
Champion automation and evangelise lean development
Improve CI/CD Release Automation
AWS Serverless Architecture
Work with DevOps and DevSecOps Teams, with emphasis on security




In this role, you should be able to work independently with little supervision.




This position will be located in Pune (India).





Who You Are




You’re looking for a challenge where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where your passion for technology, delivery, reliability, and operational excellence will impact the lives of patients fighting cancer and many other disease areas in the future.




We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer with experience in infrastructure automation and Cloud serverless services, to develop and streamline processes behind our Navify platform. Hands-on experience with AWS including proficiency of container orchestration and microservices.




Strong knowledge in Cloud Computing with emphasis on AWS and its related serverless services (Lambda, ECS, EKS, SQS, SNS, KMS, DynamoDB, Step-Functions).




You have a University degree in computer science, engineering, or other related fields, or equivalent experience. You bring experience working in a multicultural environment and proven cultural awareness.




In addition, you bring:




Strong communications skills
Team and customer focus with a proven problem-solving track record
Software development lifecycle experience, the ability to work on cross-functional teams with both technical and non-technical team members, and the desire to learn and grow within the organization
Drive and support best practice, quality, and consistency within all phases of infrastructure automation
Be able to provide accurate work estimates based on business requirements, analyse and deliver high-quality solutions to meet evolving business needs
Work with a DevOps mindset
Have strong motivation to learn and discover new technologies
AWS Certifications
Programming skills: Experience in any one or more : C / GoLang / Ruby / Python




And the following technical skills:




Python design patterns, OO programming
Proficient in Bash / PowerShell
Experience in Cloud Security and Serverless Architectures (Microservices and event driven architecture) - (Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, Step-Functions, ECS, EKS)
experience in AMI Builder tools and OS testing frameworks (ansible, packer, inspec, Git) / RPM and DEB packaging systems
Experience in developing command-line and standalone applications
Infrastructure-as-Code and related tools (CDK / Terraform / Terragrunt /CloudFormation / CI / CD )
SDLC and Agile methodologies
Design and optimise NoSQL Databases
Git / Shell / CI-CD
Knowledge of linux administration and operational experience




Nice to have would be:




AWS Certifications (Developer, Solution Architect [Associate / Professional], SysOps)
Goland or C
Experience with log/event/metric collector and visualisation tools (Grafana, ELK, Prometheus)




Please apply until 18 April 2022.




Roche embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.




If you still have questions then please check our FAQs and videos on careers.roche.ch/faq.




Who we are




At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.




Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
skills: ['Python (Programming Language)', 'AWS Lambda', 'Business Requirements', 'Container Orchestration', 'Go (Programming Language)', 'Grafana', 'Linux System Administration', 'Microservices', 'Prometheus.io', 'Ruby']

job_desc:
About the job

Job Role: Pega Testing

Exp: 4-6 Yrs

Job Description:

• Expertise in Creating Test Automation Frameworks with Selenium/Java/Python

• 4+ Years of experience in Agile environment and DevOps

• 4+ Years of experience in Pega Testing / OOTB features of Pega to build test automation framework

• Understanding of Pega Testing Concepts, Clipboard, User Matrix, PAL, Rule level testing, API testing

• Using third-party testing tools with your Pega application

• Prepare a Test Plan and Test Strategy

• Functional Testing

• Unit Testing

• UI Testing

• Mobile Testing

• API or Services Testing

• Non-Functional Testing

• Accessibility Testing

• Security testing

• Performance Testing

• Solid understanding of CI/CD Pipelines

• Expertise in setting up Automation Suites in CI/CD Environment

• Experience developing API automated testing solutions using UFT, Selenium, JUnit, Soap UI, TestNG, and JMeter

• Ability to determine strategic direction and not just tactical

• Strong programming and technical experience as this role will require digging into code and interfacing with developers and delivery managers

• Knowledge of tools and processes for results reporting

• Experience with testing big enterprise, high-traffic and multi-tier applications using MS Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS)

• Experience managing teams of Automation Engineers strongly preferred

• Good interpersonal, communication and organizational skills

• Maintains knowledge of specific technical specialists, provides detailed advice regarding their application and executes specialized tasks

• Motivated by delivery and speed to outcome

• The ability to work and team effectively with clients and other management personnel across geographies

• Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities and rapid change

• Ability to deal efficiently with escalations and difficult situations under pressure

• Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle including the functional and non-functional test phases

• Knowledge of Quality Management techniques

• Intermediate understanding of the customer services and business processes

• Knowledge of Agile and automation processes

• Demonstrates the ability to research, formulate relevant questions and seek advice about specific concepts and practices to deepen learning and application skills related to Quality Management

• Demonstrates a basic understanding of key principles related to Software Development Process Improvement.

job_desc:
About the job

Experience: 6+ years

Salary: USD 2,159 - 2,785/month (based on experience)

Expected Notice Period: 2 to 4 Weeks

Shift: 10:30 AM to 7:30 PM IST

Job Type: Remote




About the company:

The company is the #1 Japanese conversational commerce solution, driving a 9.6% average conversion rate across over 1.5 million monthly active users. Using AI-powered, human-designed conversation flows in Instagram DMs, Company enables brands to build personalized, automated conversations with their consumers and develop a deeper understanding of their preferences while creating a delightful, seamless shopping experience.




Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a QA Engineer who is passionate about their work, eager to learn and grow, and who is committed to delivering exceptional results. If you are a team player, with a positive attitude and a desire to make a difference, then we want to hear from you!




Roles & Responsibilities

Collaborate with domain experts, engineers, designers, and product management to establish and achieve quality goals
Gather information needed to perform QA activities from different stakeholders
Analyze the requirements, identify project and quality risks, and strategize QA activities accordingly
Work in an agile environment alongside the engineering team to drive and execute project plans
Work with the development team and the stakeholders to design the test plans and strategies
Lead the development team in setting up the test environment
Prioritize tests, execute them, and report issues in a timely manner
Work with the QA department to establish quality standards throughout the cross-functional teams
Automate tests and integrate them into the CI/CD pipeline if deemed necessary
Mentor Junior QA members




Project Requirements:

Over 6 years of experience within the software development industry
Willingness to learn new techniques and skills quickly
Proficiency in testing under a non-UI environmentI (back-end testing)
Good knowledge of back-end testing for microservices
Ability to collaborate with developers to plan and set up test environments
Experience with API test automation
Good understanding in event-driven architecture testing
Business-level English proficiency
Experience working in an agile environment




What Makes You Stand Out

DevOps, full-stack, or development experiences
Experience operating cloud web services (GCP, AWS, Azure)
Experience with Kubernetes
Experience working in a business based on the philosophies of lean startup and agile mindset
Experience working with SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework)
Strong communication skills and ability to liaison between domain experts, engineers, designers, and product management
Experience working on nonfunctional testing (such as performance, and security testing)
Experience in the shift-left testing approach




Our role at Uplers:

Uplers Talent Network is a place where top talents meet the right opportunities. It is a platform for every candidate looking for a perfect opportunity to work with global companies on a contractual basis. We work as a bridge between talents like you and the best global opportunities, and help you gain access to global career exposure.




With us, you'll get the support, guidance, and opportunities that you need to take your career to the next level.




How to apply for this opportunity?

Register or login on our portal & fill out the application
Clear the assessment(s) required and apply for the opportunity
Once completed, our team will contact you with an interview with our SME/Matcher
Once it’s all done, your profile will be shared with the client
When selected, just meet the client and get your exciting career started!




(Note: There are many more opportunities apart from this on the portal. Depending on the assessments you clear, you can apply for them as well).




So, if you are ready for a new challenge, a great work environment, and an opportunity to take your career to the next level, don't hesitate to apply today. We are waiting for you!
skills: ['Software Development', 'Test Automation', 'Amazon Web Services (AWS)', 'Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)', 'English', 'Google Cloud Platform (GCP)', 'Kubernetes', 'Microsoft Azure', 'Scaled Agile Framework', 'Test Planning']

We work as a bridge between talents like you and the best global opportunities, and help you gain access to global career exposure.




With us, you'll get the support, guidance, and opportunities that you need to take your career to the next level.




How to apply for this opportunity?

Register or login on our portal & fill out the application
Clear the assessment(s) required and apply for the opportunity
Once completed, our team will contact you with an interview with our SME/Matcher
Once it’s all done, your profile will be shared with the client
When selected, just meet the client and get your exciting career started!




(Note: There are many more opportunities apart from this on the portal. Depending on the assessments you clear, you can apply for them as well).




So, if you are ready for a new challenge, a great work environment, and an opportunity to take your career to the next level, don't hesitate to apply today. We are waiting for you!

job_title: Client Technology: Junior Product Owner - Cloud Layer
job_desc:
About the job
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.




Product Owner – SQL/noSQL




EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, strategy, transaction and consulting services. Technology is at the heart of what we do and deliver at EY. Technology solutions are integrated in the client services we deliver and are key to our innovation as an organization.




Fueled by strategic investment in technology and innovation, Client Technology seeks to drive growth opportunities and solve complex business problems for our clients through building a robust platform for business and powerful product engine that are vital to innovation at scale. As part of Client Technology, you will work with technologists and business experts, blending EY’s deep industry knowledge and innovative ideas with our platforms, capabilities, and technical expertise. As a catalyst for change and growth, you will be at the forefront of integrating emerging technologies from artificial intelligence (AI) to data analytics into every corner of what we do at EY. That means more growth for you, exciting learning opportunities, career choices, and the chance to make a real impact.




In Client Technology, we are looking for a Junior Product Owner, who will join the EY Fabric SQL and noSQL team. We look for a self-starter, independent-thinker, curious and creative person with ambition and passion to develop great products that will bring value to our customers and contribute in making our platform the preferred one among developers.




The opportunity




The selected candidate will:




Have a strong involvement in product backlog, ensuring the product meets the customers’ needs
Support the product management team with daily activities aligned to our SQL and noSQL products backlogs, such as analyzing requirements and assisting with product selection, development and socialization
Research and analyze qualitative and quantitative data to provide insights to the product group, and provide task-specific support where required (e.g. specification drafting)
Develop relationships across the wider product team–including technical teams, Information Security, Quality Assurance (QA)–to assist with the definition of product features and requirements
Work closely with the Development team in a daily basis, ensuring backlog alignment with product vision and strategy




Key Responsibilities Of The Role




Provide analytical support to the product group, research and present insights in line with the latest industry trends and customer requirements
Assist in the production of relevant product specifications to communicate product awareness internally and externally
Provide support in refining existing user stories and ensure that prioritized user stories are always up to date
Implement minor enhancements to existing products or services, typically receiving instructions, guidance and directions from others
Form relationships with technical and experience design teams, product managers, product owners and testers to support with the definition of business features and requirements




Skills And Attributes For Success




Experience working with relevant tools and technologies (e.g. Azure DevOps, Agile, MS Power BI, Miro, Aha!)
Experience working in an Agile framework




To qualify for the role, you must




Have 0-2 year(s) of relevant work experience
Handle ambiguity and be able to move forward even when information is not very precise, and get things done in a rapidly changing environment
Be proactive in communicating feedback to the leadership team to improve and evolve the quality of products
Be eager to cultivate and build relationships across business, IT and industry to gather intelligence and bring insights about the wider enterprise picture, and enable the adoption of emerging industry standards and approaches within EY
Be an advocate in the development and implementation of an ongoing communication plan to educate stakeholders on the purpose and benefits of Product Management
Have experience working with relevant tools and technologies (e.g. Azure DevOps, JIRA, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MS Power BI)
Have experience working in an Agile framework




Ideally, you will also have




The ability to quickly form strong working relationships with colleagues around the globe.
Experience and ability to define and develop cloud-based products and services for Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, Alibaba Cloud, Amazon AWS
Proven success in defining product features and driving feature execution – from concept to commissioning
Solid business acumen, management and marketing communication skills




EY | Building a better working world




EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.




Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.




Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
skills: ['Communication', 'Quality Assurance', 'Business Insights', 'Product Management', 'Product Selection', 'Product Vision', 'Relationship Building', 'Requirements Analysis', 'User Experience (UX)', 'User Stories']

About the job
Job Description

Role Proficiency:

Create and Organise testing process based on project requirement and manage test activities within team

Outcomes

Test Estimates and Schedules-. Ensure Test Coverage
Produce test results defect reports test logs and reports to evidence for testing
Publish RCA reports and preventive measures
Ensure Quality of Deliverables
Report project metrics and status
Ensure adherence of Engineering practices processes and standards
Understand and contribute to test automation/performance testing
Work with DevOps team when required; to understand testing framework and QA process for implementing continuous testing
Manage team utilization

Test Script Creation and Execution Productivity
Defect Leakage Metrics (% of defect leaked % of UAT defects and % of Production defects)
% of Test case reuse
Test execution Coverage
Defect Acceptance Ratio
Test Review efficiency

Test Automation Coverage

Co-ordinate Test Environment and Test Data provisioning

conduct risk analysis and ensure test coverage

Test & Defect Management

interfaces and application
